data.meta_description: Moji Afolayan (born February 5, 1969) is a Nigerian actress, filmmaker, producer and director. Afolayan hails from Agbamu, a town in Irepodun Local Government area of Kwara State southwestern Nigeria but grew up in Lagos State. data.text:
Early life

Afolayan hails from Agbamu, a town in Irepodun Local Government area of Kwara State southwestern Nigeria but grew up in Lagos State. She was born in an acting family, the first daughter of the late veteran actor and producer Ade Love who is also the father of the Kunle Afolayan and Gabriel Afolayan.

Afoloyan attended Coker Primary School at Orile Iganmu, a city in Lagos State southwestern Nigeria before she proceeded to Esie Iludun Anglican School where she obtained the West Africa School certificate.She subsequently pursued her education at Oyo State College of Education, where she received training to become a school teacher.

Film career

In 2016, Afolayan starred opposite Ojopagogo and Dele Odule in the Yoruba film Arinjo.

Personal life

She is married to Rasaq Olasunkanmi Olayiwola, a Nigerian actor popularly known by his stage name, "Ojopagogo".
